Sorry.
Here's how to do it:
1. Run keygen
2. Kill explorer.exe and fences.exe with task manager
3. go back to keygen (alt+tab)
Then once patched, you can press cntrl+alt+del to log off and then log back in so that explorer.exe starts again

Raviraj97.

To stop Explorer in Win7, hold down shift key & right click on empty area, click on exit explorer.
To restart Explorer in Win7, open task manager by ctrl+shift+esc, Click on File tab, run new task, type in explorer.exe  A quick reboot without restarting.  Works the same in Win 8.

And the readme says to close it from the system tray.  It isn't IN the system tray!!!  I can right click on my desktop, hit 'enable fences', and it restores all my fences from my old version 1.0, and then when I go to configure instead of opening up an exe like the old version did, the new 2.01 just opens up a Control Panel dialog.  maybe thats why there's no fences.exe?
